abstract: New York State arbitration panel moves to approve 1 percent raises for New York police officers who have worked for years in absence of labor deal with city; Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, union representing 24,000 rank-and-file officers in city, calls raise too small.
lead_paragraph: The increases awarded to rank-and-file officer, which cover 2010 and 2011, were deemed “an insult” by their union’s president.

headline.main: Panel Backs 1% Raises for New York Police Officers
headline.print_headline: State Panel Backs 1% Raises for City Police Officers; Union Leader Calls Amount ‘an Insult’

snippet: The increases awarded to rank-and-file officer, which cover 2010 and 2011, were deemed “an insult” by their union’s president.
